If not now, when? If not you, who?

Markup: Syntax Highlighting

August 8, 2014

From Michael's Rose [Minimal Mistakes](https://mmistakes.github.io/minimal-mistakes/markup-syntax-highlighting). Syntax highlighting is a feature that displays source code, in different colors and fonts according to the category of terms. This feature facilitates writing in a structured language such as a programming language or a markup language as both structures and syntax errors are visually distinct. [Highlighting](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syntax_highlighting) does not affect the meaning of the text itself; it is intended only for human readers.
